Package project2

Class Roster

java.lang.Object
project2.Roster
public class Roster
extends Object
The Roster class is what stores our students and handles features. The Roster class is able to add new students, remove students and can calculate tuition/payments.
Author:
Daniel Lopez, Manav Bali

    • roster

      private Student[] roster

    • size

      private int size

  • Constructor Details

    • Roster

      public Roster()

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Student student)
      Looks through the roster[] array to see if the student is in the collection.
      Parameters:
      student - that is being searched for.
      Returns:
      index if found, -1 if not in collection.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Increases the roster[] array by 4 without losing any students.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Student student)
      Checks the current roster size and adds the student to the roster[] array. If the size is too small, the array size gets increased. If the size is 0 the array roster[] is initialized.
      Parameters:
      student - that needs to be added.
      Returns:
      true if student is added, false otherwise.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Student student)
      Checks if the student is in the roster. Removes that student and moves students after the removed back a spot in the array.
      Parameters:
      student - that is being removed.
      Returns:
      true if student is removed, false otherwise.

    • print

      public void print​(javafx.scene.control.TextArea p)
      Checks if collection is empty and if not prints the entire albums[] array.
      Parameters:
      p - The textArea to be printed in.

    • printC

      public boolean printC()
      Checks if collection is empty and if not prints the entire albums[] array with tuition amount.
      Returns:
      true if roster is not empty, false otherwise.

    • calcSingle

      public boolean calcSingle​(Student student, javafx.scene.control.TextField f)
      Searches for an individual student and calculates tuition.
      Parameters:
      student - student object.
      f - text to be updated.
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise.

    • printN

      public void printN​(javafx.scene.control.TextArea p)
      Sorts roster[] by Name and prints them.
      Parameters:
      p - The textArea to be printed in.

    • printT

      public void printT​(javafx.scene.control.TextArea p)
      Sorts roster[] by Payment Date and prints them.
      Parameters:
      p - The textArea to be printed in.

    • payment

      public boolean payment​(Student student)
      Checks if the student is in the roster. Makes payment on behalf of student.
      Parameters:
      student - that is making the payment.
      Returns:
      true if payment successful, false otherwise.

    • abroadStatus

      public boolean abroadStatus​(International student)
      Checks if the International student is in the roster. Sets studyAbroad status of student.
      Parameters:
      student - that is getting study abroad changed.
      Returns:
      true if status change successful, false otherwise.

    • aid

      public String aid​(Student student)
      Checks if the student is in the roster. Sets financial aid of student.
      Parameters:
      student - that is getting financial aid.
      Returns:
      true if aid given successfully, false otherwise.

    • search

      public Student search​(Student s)
      Looks for student and returns index.
      Parameters:
      s - Student object.
      Returns:
      index if found.
